snippet: Two cultural institutions — one French, one American — have begun a program to explore how the two countries portray each other on film and television.
abstract: Library of Congress and the French Institut de National de l'Audiovisuel announce plans to exchange some 500 hours of digitized film and television footage over the next three years, as part of a program to explore how the two countries portray each other on film and television.
lead_paragraph: Two cultural institutions — one French, one American — have begun a program to explore how the two countries portray each other on film and television.

headline.seo: France and the Library of Congress Start a Media Project
headline.main: Allies With an Eye on Each Other
headline.print_headline: Allies With an Eye On Each Other
